modules.description: This module defines a recursive box model with text, padding, horizontal and vertical layouts, tables, and trees. It supports building structured layouts using algebraic data types and provides functions to convert and map k-trees into these boxes. Use it to declaratively compose formatted output for rendering in different contexts.

This module defines styling options for text rendering, including foreground and background colors, bold formatting, and preformatted text. It works with a record type `t` that encapsulates style attributes and a sum type `color` representing basic terminal colors. Use this module to customize the appearance of text output in terminal-based applications, such as highlighting code, emphasizing logs, or formatting tables with color and weight.

This module enables the construction of structured 2D layouts using boxes, text, and primitive values, supporting framing, padding, alignment, and grid/tree arrangements. It works with lists, arrays, and trees of boxes or strings to enable declarative document assembly, particularly suited for pretty-printing and multi-backend rendering like HTML or ANSI. The recursive box model allows composing layouts using algebraic data types, while the styling module provides text customization with colors, bold formatting, and preformatted text support. You can build hierarchical UIs, styled logs, or formatted tables with embedded links and anchors, targeting both terminal and structured output formats.
